source.title: Opinion: Ask your doctor if the World Series is right for you ...

facts: Drug companies bought $895.8 million worth of ads in sports programming last year.
The commercials that run during post-season baseball are rife with talk of dermatitis, dehydration, and wheezing.
Prescription drug ads were once banned on broadcasts but now the FDA permits them as long as possible side effects are clearly stated.
The World Series is watched by millions.
Dr. Caleb Alexander works at the Johns Hopkins School of Medicine Center for Drug Safety and Effectiveness.

neutral.headline: Opinion: Ask your doctor if taking medication during World Series is advisable
neutral.body_html: Millions watch the World Series, often leading to increased exposure to prescription drug ads. These commercials frequently discuss conditions like psoriasis and insomnia alongside their treatments.
